sentence: Tableau Software ( DATA ) has had a turbulent year, with its current stock price of about $45 significantly lower than its January high of $94.30.
Despite the company reporting positive year-over-year growth in all three quarters of the current fiscal year, investor sentiment has remained mixed.

The drop in the company's share price has been due to a confluence of multiple factors in the last few months, including reports by market analysts, insider share sales and concerns of renewed competition from software giants such as Microsoft, Salesforce and SAP.

Since 2011, Tableau has been able to increase its revenues at a compounded annual growth rate of over 80%, from $62 million in 2011 to $654 million in 2015, significantly outpacing growth of the business intelligence market as a whole.
In the first three quarters of the current year, the company reported revenues of $576 million, growth of 28% over the same period last year.
While the growth in revenue has been phenomenal, it has taken a toll on the company's operating expenses, which increased 41% over the prior year period and have impacted the company's bottom line.
In the long run, the company cannot realistically maintain that growth rate, and will likely see a slowdown in its revenue growth in near term.
Also, Tableau has increased its focus on international markets and has opened offices in Shanghai, Tokyo, Dublin and Sydney.

While in the long run, this shouls help the company increase its revenues from lucrative markets in Europe and Asia, the increased capital spending, greater headcount and higher general and administrative expenses is likely to take a toll on the company's profits in the short term.

Taking these factors into account, we expect the company's general and administrative expenses as a percentage of revenue to remain around 8% by the end of our forecast period against our earlier expectations of 3% in the same period.
On the basis of the aforementioned factors, we are revising our price estimate for Tableau Software to $52, which is still 15% higher than the company's current stock price.
